title: The Elevation Of A Baptismal Basin, 1920–30
description: On a foot. On a band under the rim: [th]E KINGDOM.OF.GOD; Cross in a disk: HE THAT BELIEVETH. TWO MOVABLE RINGS are shown inside top left. An arrow points to the molding: BEZEL / OUTSIDE. 2 STATIONARY RINGS top right, and an arrow: BEZEL INERSIDE / OF BOWL. Written on lower left: ST. MARK 10. / SUFFER THE LITTLE CHILDREN. Lower right: ST. MARK 16/HE THAT BELIEVETH AND IS / BAPTIZED, etc. Please return to / Det[roit] Soc. of Arts & Crafts / 47 Watson / ... (?) with incised / wording (?) 300[superscript a] / raised 325[superscript a]/ 400[superscript m] / Without th(?)ose pieces would / be considerablly lessened.

type.name: The elevation of a baptismal basin

tombstone.epitaph: The Elevation Of A Baptismal Basin, 1920–30.Pencil, creamy paper. 1939-84-60.
